dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 6981 IH: American Ammo in Defense of Ukraine Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Hudson (for himself, Mrs. Spartz, Mr. Good of Virginia, Mr. Murphy of North Carolina, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. McKinley, Mr. Upton, Mr. Emmer, Mr. Higgins of Louisiana, Mr. Babin, Mr. Balderson, Mr. LaTurner, Mr. Budd, Mrs. Harshbarger, Mr. Mast, Mr. Kinzinger, Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania, Mr. Rouzer, Mr. Feenstra, Mr. Kustoff, Mr. Garbarino, Mr. Gibbs, Ms. Foxx, Mr. Newhouse, Mr. Guest, Mr. Armstrong, Mr. Ellzey, Mr. Dunn, and Ms. Stefanik) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To authorize the President to waive export criteria and transportation and related costs for transportation of certain ammunition and ordnance to supply entities providing ammunition to Ukraine, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Ammo in Defense of Ukraine Act.

section.header: Waiver of export criteria and transportation and related costs for transportation of certain ammunition and ordnance to Ukraine

subsection.text: In the case of ammunition or ordnance with Export Classification Number 0A501 or Category 3 on the U.S. munitions list that is to be delivered to a confirmed military logistical supply entity providing ammunition to Ukraine, as designated by the Secretary of Defense, the President mayâ€”

paragraph.text: provide for the transportation of the ammunition or ordnance without charge to Ukraine for the costs of such transportation; and
waive any applicable export criteria of the Department of State or the Department of Commerce to expedite the delivery of the ammunition or ordnance.

subsection.text: The authority under subsection (a) shall terminate when the armed conflict in Ukraine ends.
